definition: sea of learning/erudite/knowledgeable person/scholarship
to learn/to study/to imitate/science/-ology

sea of learning, no horizon (idiom); no limits to what one still has to learn/ars longa, vita brevis

river of literacy, sea of learning (idiom); ars longa, vita brevis
mountain of Dao, sea of learning (idiom); learning is as high as the mountains, as wide as the seas/ars longa, vita brevis

sentences.english: There is no end in learning. A lot of efforts are needed for final achievement.

sentences.english: In an instant, I would put a huge flow of learning English.

sentences.english: Wisdom comes from the book, the book is the propeller of knowledge, let us in the university in advance.

sentences.english: Life is limited, knowledge is oceanic, selective learning is very important.
sentences.chinese: 人生有限，學海無涯，懂得選擇性吸取知識至爲重要。

sentences.english: With so many things yet to learn, Venus plans to pursue a Master's degree after graduation.
sentences.chinese: 她有感學海無涯，打算繼續深造碩士課程。

sentences.english: Learned people know they can never learn enough.

sentences.english: Swim for in learning the sea digressing from the subject arresting somewhat?

sentences.english: We have the ability to learn; let us learn.
sentences.chinese: 我們有能力學習，那我們就要在學海徜徉。
